uws.job.serializer

Class UWSSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • uws.job.serializer.UWSSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HTMLSerializer, JSONSerializer, XMLSerializer

    public abstract class UWSSerializer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    Lets returning any UWS resource in a given format.

    By default two formats are already implemented:
    • XML by the class XMLSerializer
    • JSON by the class JSONSerializer
    Version:
    4.2 (10/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)
    See Also:
    XMLSerializer, JSONSerializer, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getJob

        public java.lang.String getJob(UWSJob job,
                      java.lang.String[] attributes,
                      boolean root)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the given parameter of the given job or serializes the whole job if the given attributes array is empty or null.
        Parameters:
        job - The job whose the attribute must be serialized.
        attributes - All the given attributes (may be null or empty).
        root - false if the attribute to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a job attribute: job), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the given attribute or the serialization of the whole job if the given attributes array is empty or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while serializing the specified job/attribute/parameter/result.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

                      JobOwner user)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the given UWS for the specified user.
        Parameters:
        uws - The UWS to serialize.
        user - The user which has asked the serialization of the given UWS.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the UWS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.

      • getJobList

        public java.lang.String getJobList(JobList jobsList,

                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the given jobs list.
        Parameters:
        jobsList - The jobs list to serialize.
        root - false if the jobs list to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a jobs list: uws), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the given jobs list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.

      • getJobList

        public java.lang.String getJobList(JobList jobsList,
                          JobOwner owner,
                          boolean root)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the given jobs list, by filtering by user.
        Parameters:
        jobsList - The jobs list to serialize.
        owner - The user which has asked the serialization of the given jobs list. If null, all anonymous jobs are displayed.
        root - false if the jobs list to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a jobs list: uws), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the given jobs list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.

      • getJobList

        public abstract java.lang.String getJobList(JobList jobsList,
                          JobOwner owner,
                          JobListFilter filter,
                          boolean root)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the given jobs list, by filtering using user-specified filters.
        Parameters:
        jobsList - The jobs list to serialize.
        owner - The user which has asked the serialization of the given jobs list. If null, all anonymous jobs are displayed.
        filter - Represent all the specified job filters to apply ; only the job that pass through this filter should be displayed. If null, all jobs are displayed.
        root - false if the jobs list to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a jobs list: uws), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the given jobs list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.
        Since:
        4.2

        public abstract java.lang.String getJob(UWSJob job,
                      boolean root)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the whole given job.
        Parameters:
        job - The job to serialize.
        root - false if the job to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a job: jobList), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the given job.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.

        public abstract java.lang.String getAdditionalParameter(java.lang.String paramName,
                                      java.lang.Object paramValue,
                                      boolean root)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the specified parameter.
        Parameters:
        paramName - The name of the parameter to serialize.
        paramValue - The value of the parameter to serialize.
        root - false if the parameter to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a parameter: parameters), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.

      • getJobInfoList

        public abstract java.lang.String getJobInfoList(UWSJob job,
                              boolean root)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Serializes the list of all job information associated with the given job.
        Parameters:
        job - The job whose the job information must be serialized.
        root - false if the job information list to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a list of parameters: job), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the list of all job information.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.
        Since:
        4.2
